Metadata: Coastal flooding, wave damage and shoreline erosion will increase as climate change continues to raise sealevels and create more severe storms along Washington’s coast.Washingto​n’s Coastal Resilience Project is a three-year effort to rapidly increase the state’s capacity toprepare for natural events that threaten the coast. The project will improve risk projections, provide betterguidance for land use planners and strengthen capital investment programs for coastal restoration andinfrastructu​re. These are the tools that coastal communities need to become more resilient to disasters.
